bibl.title: Ah Chon v. Ed Delany. Petitioner's Attorney Memo to Judge
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: In the matter of application of Ah Chon a Chinaman for a writ of Habeas Corpus. To the Hon J. E. Wyche Judge of the District Court 1st Judicial Dist W.T.

The application and complaint of Ah Chon respectfully to your Honor that he is unlawfully restraint of his liberty by one E. Delaney by whom he is now imprisoned detained and confined in the county jail of Walla Walla County. That said jail is in the city and county of Walla Walla. That the cause or pretense of the restraint is this said Ah Chon was removed of selling cigars in the City of Walla without so to do and brought before L. Day City removed of said City of Walla Walla and by said recorder and on she of the fines so imposed and committed to said jail. That said L. Day and no such judicial the act of the Territory of Washington and said E Delaney acted illegally ub putting said Ah Chon in jail and continues to refusing to let your petitioner
liberty and by restraining and detaining him therefore

Whereas your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted and directed to said E. Delaney commanding him to have the body of Ah Chon before your Honor at Walla Walla WT at any time specified and received and be by may be considered lawful and proper by your Honor concerning your petitioner and the cause of this detention and that the said AH Chong may be restrored to his liberty
